Doc: An FX Accrual Digital Option product The product defines a list of fixing (or observation) dates. There are m total fixings. At the expiry date of the product, the buyer of the option has the right to an FX settlement with n/m * Notional. Payout can be cash or physical.

Source.Contents:
/#
   An FX Accrual Digital Option product The product defines a list of fixing (or observation) dates. There are m total fixings. At the expiry date of the product, the buyer of the option has the right to an FX settlement with n/m * Notional. Payout can be cash or physical.
 #/
record FpML5.confirmation.FxAccrualDigitalOption {
  # A classification of the most important risk class of the trade. FpML defines a simple asset class categorization using a coding scheme.
  primaryAssetClass : string?

  # A classification of additional risk classes of the trade, if any. FpML defines a simple asset class categorization using a coding scheme.
  secondaryAssetClass : string?

  # A classification of the type of product. FpML defines a simple product categorization using a coding scheme.
  productType : string?

  # A product reference identifier. The product ID is an identifier that describes the key economic characteristics of the trade type, with the exception of concepts such as size (notional, quantity, number of units) and price (fixed rate, strike, etc.) that are negotiated for each transaction. It can be used to hold identifiers such as the "UPI" (universal product identifier) required by certain regulatory reporting rules. It can also be used to hold identifiers of benchmark products or product temnplates used by certain trading systems or facilities. FpML does not define the domain values associated with this element. Note that the domain values for this element are not strictly an enumerated list.
  productId : string?

  # A classification of the risk class of the trade. FpML defines a simple asset class categorization using a coding scheme.
  assetClass : string?

  # A reference to the party that buys this instrument, ie. pays for this instrument and receives the rights defined by it. See 2000 ISDA definitions Article 11.1 (b). In the case of FRAs this the fixed rate payer.
  buyerPartyReference : FpML5.confirmation.PartyReference

  # A reference to the account that buys this instrument.
  buyerAccountReference : FpML5.confirmation.AccountReference?

  # A reference to the party that sells ("writes") this instrument, i.e. that grants the rights defined by this instrument and in return receives a payment for it. See 2000 ISDA definitions Article 11.1 (a). In the case of FRAs this is the floating rate payer.
  sellerPartyReference : FpML5.confirmation.PartyReference

  # A reference to the account that sells this instrument.
  sellerAccountReference : FpML5.confirmation.AccountReference?

  # Notional amount Schedule. The notional value of the product. This number divided by the total number of fixings in the fixing schedule is the amount that is accrued at each fixing if the accrual factor is one.
  notionalAmount : FpML5.confirmation.NonNegativeAmountSchedule

  # Describes accrual features within the product.
  accrual : FpML5.confirmation.FxAccrual

  # Defines the expiry of a single period accrual forward FX transaction.
  expiryDate : FpML5.confirmation.FxExpiryDate

  # The parameters for defining a schedule of expiry periods for an accrual forward FX transaction.
  expirySchedule : FpML5.confirmation.FxExpirySchedule

  # The date on which settlement takes place for a settlement period.
  settlementDate : FpML5.confirmation.FxAdjustedDateAndDateAdjustments

  # The parameters for defining a schedule of settlement periods for a accrual forward FX transaction.
  settlementSchedule : FpML5.confirmation.FxSettlementSchedule

  # A set of parameters defining procedures associated with the exercise.
  exerciseProcedure : FpML5.confirmation.ExerciseProcedure?

  # Defines one or more conditions under which the option will payout if exercisable.
  trigger : FpML5.confirmation.FxAccrualTrigger

  # Defines a knockout barrier conditions where if a barrier event occurs, the accrual process is terminated for the duration of all remaining accrual periods. Settlement rights for the next settlement are either retained or extinguished.
  barrier : FpML5.confirmation.FxAccrualBarrier?

  # Premium amount or premium installment amount for an option.
  premium : FpML5.confirmation.FxOptionPremium?

  id : string?

}

primaryAssetClass.Name: primaryAssetClass

secondaryAssetClass.Doc: A classification of additional risk classes of the trade, if any. FpML defines a simple asset class categorization using a coding scheme.

The product ID is an identifier that describes the key economic characteristics of the trade type, with the exception of concepts such as size (notional, quantity, number of units) and price (fixed rate, strike, etc.) that are negotiated for each transaction. It can be used to hold identifiers such as the "UPI" (universal product identifier) required by certain regulatory reporting rules. It can also be used to hold identifiers of benchmark products or product temnplates used by certain trading systems or facilities. FpML does not define the domain values associated with this element. Note that the domain values for this element are not strictly an enumerated list.

buyerPartyReference.Name: buyerPartyReference

buyerAccountReference.Doc: A reference to the account that buys this instrument.
buyerAccountReference.Name: buyerAccountReference

sellerPartyReference.Doc: A reference to the party that sells ("writes") this instrument, i.e. that grants the rights defined by this instrument and in return receives a payment for it. See 2000 ISDA definitions Article 11.1 (a). In the case of FRAs this is the floating rate payer.
sellerPartyReference.Name: sellerPartyReference

sellerAccountReference.Doc: A reference to the account that sells this instrument.
sellerAccountReference.Name: sellerAccountReference

notionalAmount.Doc: Notional amount Schedule. The notional value of the product. This number divided by the total number of fixings in the fixing schedule is the amount that is accrued at each fixing if the accrual factor is one.
notionalAmount.Name: notionalAmount

accrual.Doc: Describes accrual features within the product.
accrual.Name: accrual

expiryDate.Name: expiryDate

expirySchedule.Doc: The parameters for defining a schedule of expiry periods for an accrual forward FX transaction.
expirySchedule.Name: expirySchedule

settlementDate.Doc: The date on which settlement takes place for a settlement period.
settlementDate.Name: settlementDate

settlementSchedule.Doc: The parameters for defining a schedule of settlement periods for a accrual forward FX transaction.
settlementSchedule.Name: settlementSchedule

exerciseProcedure.Doc: A set of parameters defining procedures associated with the exercise.
exerciseProcedure.Name: exerciseProcedure

trigger.Doc: Defines one or more conditions under which the option will payout if exercisable.
trigger.Name: trigger

barrier.Doc: Defines a knockout barrier conditions where if a barrier event occurs, the accrual process is terminated for the duration of all remaining accrual periods. Settlement rights for the next settlement are either retained or extinguished.
barrier.Name: barrier

premium.Doc: Premium amount or premium installment amount for an option.
premium.Name: premium
